title: Dilshan Arambegedera pride of Sri Rahula
snippet: Twenty year old Dilshan Arambegedara, Grade Thirteen student of Sri Rahula College, Katogastota in the commerce stream is a fine Cricketer who is a right hand batsman and a left arm leg spin bowler. He started Cricket in the School Cricket Academy under the coaching of Sunimal Dissanayake in the year 2013 learning the basics of the game and he started his cricket career at the Under 13 level in the same year.

title: Concerned Arthur cuts down day offs
snippet: Sri Lanka's cricketers taking part in next month's ICC T20 World Cup had been given a ten day break after the bilateral series against South Africa but that has been cut down and the players and coaching staff had been reported to enter a bio-bubble tomorrow (Tuesday),

title: Yohani - not our Manike?
snippet: It is very heartening to hear that both the Prime Minister and the Opposition Leader of India have expressed their appreciation of the song Manike mage hithe, sung by the local artiste Yohani de Silva,

title: EFL 3PL sets Sri Lankan benchmark in employee experience
snippet: EFL 3PL - the country's most progressive 3rd Party Logistics Solutions Provider - has been certified as a Great Place to Work® with a benchmark score of 94% on the Trust Index© Survey, beating the national top-40-workplaces average of 85%.

title: Kohli: Skillsets of Hasaranga and Chameera will be of huge help in UAE
snippet: Royal Challengers Bangalore captain Virat Kohli believes that the additions of Sri Lanka duo Wanindu Hasaranga and Dushmantha Chameera, especially in the UAE conditions, will be a "huge help" for the team's campaign in the second leg of IPL 2021.

title: 73,000 doses of Pfizer vaccine brought to the island
snippet: Another 73,000 American Pfizer doses have been brought to the island. Hiru Airport Correspondent stated that the consignment arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport Katunayake this morning (20) on a cargo plane.

title: LOLC becomes Mastercard's first customer in Sri Lanka to join its Digital First programme
snippet: Sri Lanka's most valuable and globally diversified financial conglomerate has become the first entity in Sri Lanka to sign up for the Digital First program, launched by Mastercard. The Digital First program was initiated to facilitate an end-to-end digital journey benefiting Cardholders,

title: Sri Lanka Institute of Marketing launches SLIM DIGIS 2.1
snippet: Sri Lanka Institute of Marketing (SLIM), the national body for marketing in Sri Lanka, recently launched SLIM DIGIS 2.1, the country's most awaited digital awards ceremony in a virtual press conference held on the 16th of September 2021.

title: Fears remain oil still inside X-press Pearl
snippet: Fears remain that there may be oil still inside the sunken ship, X-press Pearl, despite various assurances given earlier, officials said. Dharshani Lahandapura, the Chairperson of the Marine Environment Protection Authority (MEPA) told Daily Mirror that foreign experts believe that there is no bunker oil remaining in the ship.

title: 27 countries in 21 months: Covid hasn't stopped Jaishankar from crisscrossing the world
snippet: Jaishankar visited 4 countries. But since Covid lockdown was lifted in August 2020, he has visited 23 countries for bilateral and multilateral business.

title: Crystal previews 2024 World Cruise - sales open 1 October
snippet: Crystal Cruises has offered a sneak-peek at its 2024 World Cruise, a 105-night adventure aboard Crystal Serenity.

title: Gangaramaya seems deserted
snippet: The Gangaramaya Temple in Colombo seemed deserted this morning following the strict travel restrictions imposed by the government due to the COVID pandemic. All religious activities in temples were suspended,

title: PM returns from Italy
snippet: Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa and his delegation who were on an official visit to Italy to attend the G20 Interfaith Conference, returned to the island this morning, the Katunayake Airport Duty Manager said.

title: More Pfizer vaccines arrive in Sri Lanka
snippet: More doses of the US-manufactured Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine have arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Sri Lanka

title: Fertilizer shortage to deprive Sri Lanka of critical forex earnings
snippet: Due to the shortage of suitable fertilizer, Sri Lanka is unlikely to be able to achieve its export earnings target for 2021, according to the Planters' Association of Ceylon (PA), which also reiterated calls for a sustainable solution to the worsening crisis.

title: Discover the Wonders of Wilpattu National Park Sri Lanka via Wildlife Streaming
snippet: On 24th and 26th September, the Wilpattu National Park goes live! A 'Couch Safari' will take viewers on a wildlife streaming tour of Sri Lanka's oldest and largest national park, allowing them to experience the wonders of Wilpattu from the safety of their homes.

title: Economic crisis in Sri Lanka shows organic farming doesn't happen overnight

title: PM Mahinda Rajapaksa returns to the island (Video)
snippet: Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa and his delegation arrived at the island this morning (20) concluding their tour to Italy. Hiru Airport Correspondent stated that the Prime Minister and his entourage arrived at the island on a SriLankan Airlines flight UL 309 from Singapore.

title: Sri Lanka's Ceylon Tea exports up 15-pct in July 2021, Iraq top buyer
snippet: Sri Lanka's Ceylon Tea exports grew 15.7 percent in August 2021 from 25.48 million kilograms in pandemic hit, 2020, though down from 2.75 percent from 2019, industry data shows.

title: Former St. Peter's cricketer Berenger on the cusps of representing third national team

title: All-women Indian Army Officers Summit Mount Manirang In Himachal Pradesh
snippet: Five women officers of the Indian Army summited Mount Manirang (6595m) in Himachal Pradesh as part of the Tri-services All Women Mountaineering Expedition.

title: Lankan Angel Network & Angel Fund Appoint First Female Chairperson
snippet: The Lankan Angel Network (LAN), the country's largest network of angel investors, has appointed Chandi Dharmaratne as its Chairperson for 2021/2022, at its most recent Board Meeting held i. Ms. Dharmaratne is the first woman to lead the Lankan Angel Network.

title: Fmr. MP Ranjith Aluvihare infected with COVID

title: No place like home

title: Watawala Plantations re-affirms their persistent drive towards sustainable agriculture in Sri Lanka
snippet: Affirming their deep-rooted commitment to sustainability, Sri Lanka's leading diversified agribusiness company Watawala Plantations PLC (WPL), is strongly pushing for change within the industry with strong efforts to promote encourage sustainable agriculture practices.

title: Sri Lanka Mannar, Cauvery basin oil blocks gravity magnetic survey on track
snippet: UK-based BellGeospace has completed 60 percent of an aerial gravity magnetic survey in the shallows of Mannar and Cauvery basins and will be licensing the data to oil prospectors, officials said.

title: Suspend Lohan's party membership: March 12 Movement tells SLPP
snippet: Highlighting the need to appoint a committee of professionals to investigate the incident involving State Minister Lohan Ratwatte, the March 12 Movement today urged Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) to suspend his party membership and probe his anti-disciplinary actions.

title: Woman serving life imprisonment found innocent: CA observes trial judge misdirected himself of the facts
snippet: After spending more than two years in prison, a woman sentenced to life imprisonment for drug trafficking was acquitted by the Court of Appeal, observing that the High Court judge has misdirected himself of the facts during the trial.

title: Sri Lanka opposition MP summoned to CID with no explanation: lawyer
snippet: Sri Lanka main opposition Samagi Jana Balavegaya (SJB) MP Manusha Nanayakkara has been summoned by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) with no explanation provided, the MP's lawyer said. Nanayakkara was requested to meet the CID on Monday (20).

title: Closer Bangladesh-Myanmar ties have great economic potential - but Rohingya issue must be resolved

title: Govt. issues deadline for unvaccinated people to get jabbed
snippet: The people who are above 30 years of age and not vaccinated so far, should get their vaccines within this week, the Government said today. ..

title: Government ready to spend billions to clean Kelani River: Environment Minister
snippet: The Kelani River is the most polluted of the 103 rivers in our country. The Kelani River is also used by the majority of the people of Gampaha and Colombo for drinking and other water needs. The government considers the cleaning of the Kelani River as a priority.

title: Lankan Prez discusses reconciliation with UN chief Guterres
snippet: Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday said he held a "fruitful discussion" with UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres on ways to jointly promote "reconciliation" in the country as the only way to move towards a prosperous future.

title: Galle Will win LPL This Season, Feels Team Owner Nadeem Omar
